website_summaries.verdict: One of the best looking carport canopy devices you'll find at a reasonable price point with good stability.
pros: Carport consists of six steel legs that will give the carport a nice level of stability
Powder-coated steel frame with 1.5-inch of diameter that will stand up to rust problems
Includes heavy duty bungee cords to keep the canopy tarp tightly affixed to the frame
Provides a large coverage area for your vehicle
cons: Requires multiple people to assemble it
Will not stand up to heavy wind storms

customer_reviews.title: Easy-peasy set-up for one person
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why people said it took 2 people and 2 hours? It took me (a handy chick) about 45 minutes. To deal with the issue of the tubing falling out when trying to assemble, I just used a bit of duct tape to hold the joints together. Pretty much followed the instructions - not hard. The stakes it comes with are lame, so ordered some spiral dog tie-out stakes. I live in a gross part of Sacramento, so do not care that this looks janky as it will keep my truck in the shade. Hope it lasts, but for the price point it seems decent.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel M

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable canopy
customer_reviews.text: This canopy perfectly covers our patio. We bought it because the summers in NM are HOT and we wanted a bit of shade. This item provides a lot of shade. We had to weight it down with sandbags and stakes due to we have had an active monsoon season this year, but even in high wind conditions it is stable and standing up to the elements. I would definitely recommend this canopy.
customer_reviews.author: Twilight

customer_reviews.title: 10' x 20' Back Yard Patio Canopy
customer_reviews.text: Wife and two teenage daughters we're able to assemble this in around 15 minutes. Pros: + accurate sizing + ease of assembly + easy to move fully assembled + adjustability of tarp to leg attachments + more than adequate points to secure tarp to frame + has held up extremly well to wind storms + stitching and seem quality Cons: - absence of mountable curatins for privacy - price isn't horrible, but could be better Summry: Assembly was a breeze, adjustments to tarp tension is quick/easy, easy to relocate and we're hoping that this holds up for many more years to come. < RECOMMEND >
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the use as an actual carport, the tarp is pretty good quality seems to have great tight braids and seems to have some type of plastic coating to help longevity. The stakes they send you are probably better suited as a spare set of tent stakes. I made a few improvements of my own and also got some 15" screw in dog line ties and secured all four corners down. Has so far with stood some heavy rain (havent had it too long) and winds so far up to 25 mph! It shakes a bit from the wind though ;)
customer_reviews.author: cody d.

customer_reviews.title: Once material gets a tear it shreds though whole thing
customer_reviews.text: Noticed a small tear on the top a week ago and now the whole damn thing is ripping apart. Whole top part is gone now hanging down on my car. Bought this only a year ago! And no hurricanes, Tropical storms, etc in case you were wondering...just a faulty cover.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy H.

customer_reviews.title: and so easy to put up My Husband and I put it ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually take the time to write reviews unless the product is way above my expectations. And this is one of those products. I was surprised that this was made as well as what it was. and so easy to put up My Husband and I put it up without any problems. I needed something that I could keep up and provide shade for the two Rabbits that I got for the granddaughter. And this was exactly what I needed . I put it in the corner of the yard and gosh darn ! if it doesn't even look good ! I would Highly recommend this. Thank you Abba for a great little carport
customer_reviews.author: close

customer_reviews.title: perfect truck cover
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to assemble.Perfect cover for my Toyota Tundra.Thanks to another reviewer who suggested duck taping joints where pipes slip together so they will not separate during assembly
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Scott Babb

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Had this canopy for about a year and then the top of the cover had a small rip which grew with time. Quite disappointed that customer support couldn't help with this. Everything was carefully assembled and securely anchored. I'm not ready to purchase new canopy covers every year! I live in California with very low winds too!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Tarp does not last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in January of 2018 and was very happy with it in the beginning. Within a year the tarp deteriorated and fell apart. The seller was nice enough to immediately send a replacement tarp but once again, just under a year, the replacement tarp has completely deteriorated as well. Seems these tarps cannot handle the Florida sun and need some kind of UV protection. I guess I'm stuck buying a replacement tarp every year and they won't help me with the cost in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Hung Dale

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product at all. It’s been 6 months since purchasing. - and we just had our first rain. The cover has already shown holes, and stress. This was purchased to cover a vehicle, but if it can’t handle 6 months in the sun, it’s worthless. I would not recommend this item. I’d rather get my money back
customer_reviews.author: dustin fedak

customer_reviews.title: Terribly cheap garbage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely terrible. Even though I had it anchored with the recommended pools, it ripped out of the ground and broke my neighbors window. Also the cover ripped just from being in a strong wind. The weak metal bar is bent right in half at the slightest gust. Do not buy this terrible product
customer_reviews.author: Brady S. Vallala

customer_reviews.title: Check to be sure that all the parts are correctly drilled before setup!
customer_reviews.text: Product came with completely incorrect upright legs that were undrilled, but the company responded to me promptly, and as expected, asked me to send some pictures showing that the legs were, in fact, undrilled. The service representative contacted the factory to see if the parts could be shipped separately, but it turned out that it was just simpler to send me a completely new canopy, which works for me because now I can customize the old one with through bolts and lock washers and see what kind of abuse this thing can take in the face of cold Pacific winds and rain....with spare parts to allow for my own mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Great buy as a horse shelter
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money, but I think the price went way up since we purchased last summer. We used it all winter in a horse pasture as shelter for up to four horses. Usually only three fit completely underneath. We anchored each leg to a t-post for stability and put panels against one long side, otherwise it was open. It was a mild winter with only a few inches of snow and we don't get a lot of wind. We do get a lot of rain though and it held up great and looks to be almost new still.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good value, not excellent
customer_reviews.text: My canopy arrived with two puncture holes in it. Gorilla tape to the rescue! The stitching is fragile so take care during assembly not to rip the seams while you are attaching the canopy. The frame assembles pretty easily and overall this is a good value. If you live in a desert environment and plan on having this up permanently, plan on replacing the canopy every 1-2 years. This purchase was a replacement purchase for my last one that I never got around to anchoring which the wind destroyed. Which reminds me. Anchor this canopy with the provided anchors if you are setting this up on wood or concrete.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Te poles cannot support a snow load.
customer_reviews.text: The product collapsed during the first snowfall. The poles bent like soda straws. It also flipped over on a windy day in the fall and had to be rebuilt and anchored with weights. This product should not be used in places that have significant snowfalls
customer_reviews.author: michael lebeau

customer_reviews.title: Used it in the summer to protect our lawn and stepping stones
customer_reviews.text: We live where the summers get hot. Multiple days at 100+. The new sod we put in was burning. Our small dogs would use the stepping stones and we were worried they would burn their feet. Yes - it gets that hot. Bought this carport canopy - staked it into the ground just past the patio and used it all summer. It's wonderful. It took 3 of us to put it together - 30 minutes max. It's durable and I'm tempted to buy another one for the other side of the pool where the concrete can burn your feet. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Lasted thirteen months
customer_reviews.text: This is a great carport, really sturdy, and good looking. I bought this thirteen months ago, and the cover ripped in last night’s windstorm. I didn’t closely examine it prior to the windstorm, but I hadn’t noticed any signs of deterioration prior to this. It was amazing until it wasn’t, which is exactly what I suspect you’d want in a product. I guess I wish it would have lasted two years instead of just one, though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Transtrum

customer_reviews.title: Easier to install than originally thought.  ~30 mins with 2 people.
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to put up, albeit I had my brother help. But seemingly easier than the ones that are supposed to be easy to setup. Haven't had many wind storms yet, so far holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Good carport
customer_reviews.text: I have my Ram 2500 parked under it. This carport has slightly heavier poles than the previous model I had which blew away and scratched my truck. Since erecting the carport we have had some gusty days with winds up to 15-to-20 MPH. Some movement, but the legs are staked down as all is good so far. If we have higher wind gusts I may take the cover off.
customer_reviews.author: Roger E.

customer_reviews.title: Find a different anchor method
customer_reviews.text: The car port is great. Material is solid. Had it anchored in the driveway. Can't blame the canopy but the wind carried it 40ft and landed on a power line. Regardless its the best one I've bought despite the wind tossing it around and I will be getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, but use some tape until its upright
customer_reviews.text: Very stable after its up and tied down. to assemble use tape to hold poles together until its up and cover is tight. Would be nice to have pre drilled holes and screws to hold poles together, only reason its not 5 stars. For the money, its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: dukester

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and looks great but after setting it up again in a different location I noticed some discoloration in the tarp portion. Be careful one of the corner straps broke from I guess just sitting there. I just wish these tarps lasted longer than a couple years. I see it falling apart by next summer.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent for Price
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty tent. Used for a party. Tired of buying $100 and $200 Pop Up Tents that are taken down by wind and bent to heck. This tent does not move and has much more room. Great for special events or for covering something long-term.
customer_reviews.author: W & T

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The Patio Canopy was put up by my son in only a few hours and he anchored the legs in the concrete of our driveway. It is attractive and believe me, it is going nowhere. I am using it as a car port for my black car that was impossible to keep the sap from the trees off it. This will do the trick. Would buy again. Thank you for a great product. .
customer_reviews.author: Fair Oaks Reader

customer_reviews.title: Play area cover for kids
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my backyard as a covering for the play area for the kids. It provides shade, keeps the rain out and it holds up to bad weather. Such a good find for the price. My husband and I put it up in an hour and a half but it took a ladder and a few mishaps before we got it up. It would be easier with three or four people.
customer_reviews.author: Retro Daycare

customer_reviews.title: I've only had it up or about a week....
customer_reviews.text: Thus far, only having it a week, I am relieved that it wasn't as "cheesy" as I feared. (LOL) My husband put it up by himself, within only a few hours . All of the connections are quite secure, and the tarp of greater quality than expected. It also secured nicely. He bolted it down to concrete blocks. I originally thought I may be buying a "replaceable" item, but this seems it will hold up for quite some years. Considering the spot we chose for it, I think it may even do well thru our FL storms.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you tie this down.Up date 11.7.2018
customer_reviews.text: I installed in January 2018 and I sure thought the canopy would hold up better than it did 11.7.2018 If you plan to put this up in a sunny place it will take the life right out of it.One year later now the seams are coming apart and the material is starting to split so I hope to get two years out of the cover.I won't but another and toss the loss again will go with another metal carport.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great value, for Fair Weather.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good for the money. I used metal screws to hold the joints together, which I recommend doing. Took me one hour to assemble by myself. Update: I didn't expect this to do super well with the snow but after about 4-5" it caved in, bent metal, damaged my boat. I had to take it to the dump. Works well for fair-weather only.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: it was very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my back deck, it was very easy to put together, we did need at least three or four people, with at least one person being a little taller to get the legs in and lifted up. This was easier to put up then any smaller canopy I’ve bought. It has rained for the past two nights and did not leak at all or move, I did secure it to my deck with Screw to make sure it would not move. I would highly recommend it and I give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Very disappointed..

customer_reviews.title: It is good, but it lasts about a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this canopy about a year ago. It is a great canopy and very sturdy; it has performed well, but recently it started to rip and all of a sudden, today, it was ripped through the middle hanging on top of my car. I like the product very much, but I would have liked it to last longer because it has not been moved since it was installed. Too bad it does not last longer than about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: saved a bundle
customer_reviews.text: put it together in 1:5hrs. by myself. the perfect fit was a little dicey / pulled as hard as I could and so not perfect but saved a bundle . could have spent a bunch on a water tight cover for my boat but this works well.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Keller

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: Very good item for the money. Keeps my bimmer nice and cool under California sun. 4/10/19 update: Frame is strong no problems there, but the canopy is failing. There are small tears on the top and the color has faded significantly on the side exposed to the sun. It's definately not UV resistant. Good for about 9 months, then need to replace the canopy before it falls apart.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: ... that's under an oak tree dropping lots of acorns like rain. Impressed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Using it as a temporary structure for a new car that's under an oak tree dropping lots of acorns like rain. Impressed with the quality. I bought 12" stakes for it. I take my car out when it's windy because I don't trust it 100% - but so far so good. For the price, you'd be hard pressed to get better.
customer_reviews.author: DGAB

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I like this canopy. I could set up the frame myself in under 3 hours and install the canopy in less than two additional hours. I like the metal feet - sturdy and won't break in a high wind. Looks good, and it should last for about two years before we'll need another canopy cover..
customer_reviews.author: I Writer I

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product, but I did find some of the female pole ends enough out of round that I had to round it out using a smaller pipe and rubber mallet. Still, I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ahnko Chee

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Went through tropical storm force winds for me here on the Gulf Coast when the storm hit NOLA in July, protecting my new truck for almost 4 months now. I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last 2 years!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it less than 2 years and it’s already ripping!!! We live in California so no major weather and there are no trees or anything around to cause the rip. I almost was about to buy a second one...sooooooo disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Courson

customer_reviews.title: Will bend in the wind
customer_reviews.text: The first decent wind to come along after I erected my new canopy, it bent one of the corners bead enough that it couldn’t be used anymore. I have to buy a second canopy to secure the one bent corner. I guess I have a couple spares next time it happens.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: For the price I doubt that there is a better carport than this one. Love the overhang. It seems to keep it place better as not as much wind rushes under it directly under the canopy. My husband put it up by himself in about 20min or so. We did bolt it to our concrete driveway as opposed to relying solely on the stakes. The poles are both bigger & thicker than the last carport we had.
customer_reviews.author: D. Akers

customer_reviews.title: Good carport
customer_reviews.text: Love this tarp. Store my motorcycle under in. As well as we built a tiki bar under it. The only thing i dont like is water will seep though the holes where its sewn together.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Patrick

customer_reviews.title: This serves as an awesome cover for our daughters swingset
customer_reviews.text: This serves as an awesome cover for our daughters swingset. We live in Los Angeles and get no shade in the backyard...until now! It’s very high quality and durable. We have had it up several weeks and still looks awesome and stands up to wind.
customer_reviews.author: Jianine

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these covers before. This one is made really good and very easy to set up. Great to have the corners come down the sides , so it keeps the corners from flapping in the wind. The mounts at the bottom of the poles is great to secure it. Worth the money and very well made!
customer_reviews.author: ilovetobike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, and easy to put together!
customer_reviews.text: This covered our driveway width wise, and since it was raining it was the perfect addition onto the garage to keep people covered at my daughter's birthday party.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Hachey

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality and fairly easy to assembly
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the product, I assembled it without too much difficulty. But you will need a second person or more if you are short. I had some difficulty installing the poles. Overall, the product seems decent quality. Will have to see how it stands up to the UV rays. So I give a good rating overall.
customer_reviews.author: ava

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this tent for outside event. It is great material and for a great price. Everyone loved it and many have ordered after me
customer_reviews.author: JRL

customer_reviews.title: An excellent party shelter'
customer_reviews.text: Set it up by myself. I'm 74 and have Parkinson's. It would have been easier with two people but it only took me 45 min. anyway. An excellent party shelter'
customer_reviews.author: gary m. edmister

customer_reviews.title: TOUGH
customer_reviews.text: Had this now for 3 years, held up to all kinds of wicked weather. Just now had to replace the cover, frame still standing proud. Be sure to anchor it down.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Henley

customer_reviews.title: High quality!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this canopy adding extra support for the ground, but we had it up for a full six months (with several 40mph winds. We just took it down today. It is still in "like new" condition! Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B. Heckman

customer_reviews.title: Nice shade and coverage
customer_reviews.text: I was completely amazed how easy it was to mount. Obviously, I needed an assistance. And, since I live in FL anchoring was a concern--nothing to do with the canopy, but drilling into cement. It offers a great deal of shade and it matches the color of my home.
customer_reviews.author: Noble Lee Lester

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck best canopy
customer_reviews.text: This canopy provides the Most bang for your buck out of any canopy out there. May not last forever but solidly built and appears that it will make through a couple seasons of use. Also looked like you can repurchase the topper when the time comes to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Huffy

customer_reviews.title: Shipping box is very heavy and difficult to handle.
customer_reviews.text: I like the setups now that they're up. I bought 2 for a side-by-side for my 2 cars. Look great! It's just that at delivery, the UPS guy had trouble getting them off his truck and into my storage area. Was just as unwieldy taking the stuff out to get put up. Have help on hand for receipt and set up!
customer_reviews.author: Carlson Kukona

customer_reviews.title: Excellant product
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with our car port. We live in the city,our driveway is a shared driveway 2 car widths wide. This is perfect to offer us the protection from elements without having to worry about encroaching on neighbors spot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for the money.
customer_reviews.text: We assembled this tent with anchors and tie downs from other sellers. The entire tent was a pleasant addition to our back yard, with the moderate winds, the 90+ temps were tolerable. Last night's violent thunderstorms were the true test! The tent appears to be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FL weather, but still looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought <1yr ago. Def need 2 ppl to assemble, and is a bit tricky w/o poles locking together, but well worth the effort. I sprayed all the pole ends with clear krylon... no rust, except for little hooks that attach the tarp "legs" to the bottom of poles. Great value but doesn't look cheap. Has braved FL tropical storms like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: jax-girl

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our backyard for shade and I’m so glad we bought it! The material was thick and is overall very sturdy. It took my husband less than an hour to put together. If using it for a driveway, you could easily fit 2 cars
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Saved our newly detailed Mercedes
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't use our garage for a few months and the summer sun on a black vehicle could wreak havoc. This cover has been terrific!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mills

customer_reviews.title: Where are the bungee with ball?
customer_reviews.text: So where are the bungees with the ball? Had to make a special trip to the store half way through assembling....grrr
customer_reviews.author: Janice C. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Nice carport and nice price.
customer_reviews.text: The carport was very nice. My husband and brother put it together in less than an hour. It is going to be great for our family picnics and just for me and hubby to just hangout under . Nice product and worth what we paid for. Arrived 3 days earlier than what they said. ABBA Patio is a nice company to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great shade
customer_reviews.text: Put it up for temporary shade while building patio and now it is a garage for four wheeler, zero turn mower and our ranch golf cart, really pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ricketson

customer_reviews.title: dont buy it !!!!
customer_reviews.text: absolute junk ,pipe fits loosly falls apart.does not have locking nubs .JUNK THIS IS NOT HEAVY DUTY AS DESCRIBED ,I CALL BS .FRAUD ADVERTISING !
customer_reviews.author: zebra

customer_reviews.title: Does not last a year.
customer_reviews.text: This product does not last more than a year. We had it completely fall apart the first winter. The company replaced it and this year we had no snow or ice but the canopy spilt across the top anyway. We paid for insurance but they said it was normal wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Durability
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit up since October 2019 and the weather has been fairly mild here in the Monterey Bay area. But on !/9/20 we had 50 to 70 MPH winds and I must say that this unit stayed intact I have the six legs in a 5 gallon buckets with pea gravel 3/4 filled. I was shocked as to how this unit with held this wind storm. This is a good one
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: NOT EVEN WINDY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and after a windy night, (BUT NOT THAT WINDY, NO POWER LOST OR TREES DOWN ANYWHERE) it ripped it from the ground and next thing I know it was on my roof of my house. I reached out to the company but never did get a reply. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my back porch and hung some outdoor lights under it. It looks so nice and I put it together all by myslef in under an hour with no hiccups. Every fit together nicely. A++
customer_reviews.author: Megan Lambert

customer_reviews.title: great tent, strong and easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: this is a great tent/canopy for events. it is very strudy and easy to put up. each piece is labeled A, B, C. take only a few minutes to put and take down. It will last many years. would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: phong y.

customer_reviews.title: Frame is sturdy.  Canopy was not.
customer_reviews.text: The frame was relatively simple to put together and was sturdy. It's heavy enough for light wind but If you get a lot of stronger winds, you will need to anchor the frame or weigh it down. The canopy fit well but as you can see from the photos, it barely lasted 1 year. I am ordering a new canvas cover now from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Crear quality
customer_reviews.text: It took 3 adults to build it in about 40 min. The material is great! Beautiful color and durable. I was able to fit 2 cars an SUV and a Sedan and I still have extra room.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Mostly satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Tarp has two small holes in it..just going to put tarp tape on them....other wise I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finding a replacement Pole?
customer_reviews.text: I would like to inform others that the Carport Canopy is not Fabric as stated. It is material made of a Plastic material. However it is water proof and sturdy for the most part. Unfortunately we had some strong winds here recently and one of the poles snapped, and I need a replacement pole but I am not finding anywhere on the site to order the part.
customer_reviews.author: Ted D.

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a pop up tent
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a number of canopies for our festival and the Abba patio canopy was much sturdier than the pop up canopies and only took a few minutes more to set up. The best part was it was able to support the lights and electrical outlets we needed and looked great overall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tarp wears through quickly...
customer_reviews.text: After year of use tarp has worn holes in several areas... wish it were stronger; hoping they sell a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Shasta

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: It's good enough to get the job done. Covers a single car or boat Easy 2 assemble Allows me to work on my car when it's raining Definitely a 2 man job NOTE: you absolutely need ground anchors!!! The ones that come with this kit are useless. I used 18in anchors ($20) that drill into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up. Held up so far through wind storms and snow storms. I anchored it to the concrete and I made sure to knock the snow off to not get too heavy and have been very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Vinsanity

customer_reviews.title: Did not last very long
customer_reviews.text: As others have commented, the fabric just starts ripping apart. We bought this in June of 2018, and at just over a year old, it's already got 5 major rips along the seams. I do not see this lasting a second year. Before the rips, I did like it, however rather upset about the quality. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great canopy for the money.  Well built and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy and stout canopy for our use in front of the food trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Awesome carport, easy to set up, seems very sturdy, absolutely love it
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Conopy didn’t last 1 year; determinated ; have to buy another
customer_reviews.author: David Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: Great Carport
customer_reviews.text: Great canopy for the cost! I parked my Tesla under this for about 2 yrs, and it worked great. Zero Issues.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Tearing at the seems
customer_reviews.text: We put it up end of May 2019, already tearing at the seems! Not happy with this one... Sandra Eberwein
customer_reviews.author: Dennis & Sandy.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: So far it is great. Put a piece of tape to hold parts together during install and it went up great and after dark
customer_reviews.author: Seubanks

customer_reviews.title: Will definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Using on the deck of a ship in dry dock. It’s been over a month and it still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: About as sturdy as a piece of tin fold
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about a month. Had a very very calm storm. To give you an example how calm the storm was. No leaves on the ground. No flooding. Our small grill canopy held up fine. This thing. Twisted and snapped in half from light wind. Caused several thousands in damage to my car.
customer_reviews.author: kyle K

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this canopy to use as a carport. It looks great, was easy to put up works a treat! Well made, well done!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canopy top didn't last 90 days!
customer_reviews.text: See pictures the canopy top has tiny holes though out. Weather has been normal no strong winds etc., its not under any trees it has just started wearing through in less than 3 months! All we have had is random rain storms but nothing major. The frame is good but the canopy is garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Barfield Liquidations

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: It was great until it snowed in middle of nite. Collasped on my new car causing 5k worth of damage
customer_reviews.author: Paul Blank

customer_reviews.title: Great shade for cars
customer_reviews.text: My car was sitting in the hot Florida sun all day. My niece's husband erected the Abba patio/carport canopy for me. I am totally enjoying it. It keeps the hot sun off of my car---and when I get in the car to go on errands it's not like stepping into an oven.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sayler

customer_reviews.title: cheap material cover
customer_reviews.text: I purchased on October of last year and their holes in canopy so when the rain falls. The water just pours through. Very disappointed. The items I keep under the tent is constantly getting wet the material is flimsy
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup for at least 2 people. All parts are clearly marked, and the top was a perfect fit. This is a product I use for outdoor events and camping, and isn't something I leave set up all year.
customer_reviews.author: Travis L.

customer_reviews.title: Have help putting it together.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, all parts were in the box!!!! Be advised to assemble it where you plan on using it because it’s big and took 4 of us to move it after we assembled it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality a 30 minute set up with four people.
customer_reviews.text: This was a very easy set up. Took me and three of my grandsons 30 minutes to set it up. I’m giving it a four-star because I’m going to see how it holds up in the winter. Good quality and I love the color it matches the siding on the house. I was concerned about my Chevy traverse fitting under it, and it did with no problem. Can probably get my sons 2017 Chevy Sierra under it. I will let you know how it holds up in the Michigan winters.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Baker

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than renting one!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for an outdoor party. It was cheaper than renting one and just as good of quality. We have had several friends borrow it and loved it. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle E.

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Cheap nice shade. Quality materials and very easy to assemble. 3 people took about ~30 mins. Looks like it will make it through a Florida 1.5 years. Very happy over all, it can be a party tent when the time comes also.
customer_reviews.author: E Bales

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shade for hot summer days.
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in less than 30 minutes. Provides perfect / cooling shade on sunny days.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Improve quality control !
customer_reviews.text: I like it but one fitting had broken wield : ( I got it up but worried how long it will stay up in wind. Manufacturer needs better quality control where they wield fitting together. Just being honest!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Garriz

customer_reviews.title: definitely needs to be screwed together
customer_reviews.text: A darker brown would be nice. Keeps the sap of the paint & sunroof
customer_reviews.author: J Cyril

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, recommend self tapping screws at all pipe joint to prevent poles from sliding out during assembly and also to increase stability during windy weather. I would recommend product to anyone! Satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very strong.
customer_reviews.text: I love this carport. I was actually looking for a gazebo and was really difficult for me to decide. This is my best choice! Beige is so elegant, it goes perfectly with the floor and furniture in my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and nice
customer_reviews.text: It may not be very easy to mount, you will need a person to help you, but it is strong and it looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos G.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I put this up three summers ago for an event and it is still standing. It fell once, but I believe my dog pulled the stakes out. Otherwise it is still there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and stable
customer_reviews.text: I love this carport canopy!!! It is heavy duty and stable. It helps that I read the reviews first about the best way to put it together!!! I love it and may buy another one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Niecy1109

product_meta.title: Abba Patio 10 x 20 ft Outdoor Carport Car Canopy Portable Garage Tent Boat Shelter for Party, Wedding, Garden Storage Shed with 6 Steel Legs and Fabric Pole Skirts, Cream
feature_bullets: [POWDER COATED FRAME] ► Heavy duty 1-1/2-inch diameter powder coated steel metal carport frame resists chipping, peeling, rust and corrosion and provides increased stability
[DURABLE FABRIC] ► Polyethylene fabric durable cover is UV-resistant, Water-resistant, protecting your cars or boats against wind, rain and snow

[AMPLE SPACE] ► 10x20 ft carport provides ample space for your vehicles. It's terrific for storing and protecting trucks, boats and all sorts of other expensive tools and toys. It also providies shades and shleters for outdoor events like parties, weddings, picnics and other commercial uses

[ADDITIONAL ACCESSORIES INCLUDED] ► Heavy-duty bungees cord tightly secure the tarp cover to the frame. Foot pads are installed to the canopy legs for added stability and easy access to secure anchor points

[EASY TO INSTALL] ► This carport kit is easy to set up, fully collapsible for easy transport and storage. All hardware for assembly and instructions are included. We warmly advise to take down your carport during extreme weather
